mm1.title: Mega Man 1
mm1.description: Mega Man 1 is where the series all started. It introduced many series staples such as choosing the order you complete stages in, gaining abilities from the robot masters you defeat, and a rock-paper-scissors style weapons system.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm2.title: Mega Man 2
mm2.description: Mega Man 2 took everything that was good in the first game and made a lot of improvements. It increased the number of robot masters from 6 to 8, added new items that helped with platforming, added a password save feature, and increased the level of overall polish.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm3.title: Mega Man 3
mm3.description: Mega Man 3 was another solid entry, introducing the slide mechanic as well as Mega Man's robotic dog Rush. This was also the first game to feature Proto Man
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm4.title: Mega Man 4
mm4.description: Mega Man 4 Was the first game to feature the charge buster as well as the helper robot Eddie. It also started the tradition of focusing on a villain other than Dr. Wily, in this case Dr. Cossack.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm5.title: Mega Man 5
mm5.description: Mega Man 5 used the same foundation as the other NES games while introducing Beat as a new helper character. In this game Proto Man seemingly acted as the main villain.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm6.title: Mega Man 6
mm6.description: Featuring a story about a robot tournament and the mysterious Mr. X, Mega Man 6 continued a lot of the traditions established by previous games. It also introduced new forms the player could transform into by combining with Rush: the Jet Mega Man and Power Mega Man forms
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm7.title: Mega Man 7
mm7.description: Mega Man 7 brought the classic series onto the Super Nintendo. It was set apart by its larger sprites, robot master stages that were split into two sets of 4, and a variety of unlockable secrets and power-ups. It introduced a shop manned by the new character Auto, as well as a new rival character: Bass (accompanied by Treble).
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm8.title: Mega Man 8
mm8.description: Mega Man 8 was the first game on 32-bit hardware. It featured fluid animation, animated cutscenes, and voice-acting. It had some unique power-ups such as the Mega Ball, and split stages into two separate sections. It also introduced the character Duo.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm9.title: Mega Man 9
mm9.description: Mega Man 9 imitated the style and design of the classic NES games, taking Mega Man 2 as a jumping off point and removing the slide and charge mechanics. It also added Proto Man as a playable character, and was the first game to include DLC.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm10.title: Mega Man 10
mm10.description: Mega Man 10 followed Mega Man 9's approach of emulating the classic NES entries. Overall a solid game with interesting boss weapons and interesting level design. It also included both Proto Man and Bass asplayable characters.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
Non-linear stage select
Gain a weapon from each main boss defeated
Rock-Paper-Scissors style weapon system against bosses
First and only appearance of the magnet beam
First and only appearance of a points system
Only game with 6 rather than 8 Robot Masters

mm11.title: Mega Man 11
mm11.description: After a long gap without any new games, Mega Man 11 marked a long waited for return to the Classic series. It introduced the Double Gear System, which allows Mega Man to temporarily increase his power, slow down time, or both.
newFeatures: Introducing Mega Man, Dr. Wily, Dr. Light, and Roll
Classic Mega Man run, jump, and shoot gameplay
